text: geothermal pools have become a symbol of
Icelandic culture a community fixture in
many towns in Iceland these pools draw
their heat from the country's natural
geothermal energy
I spend sits above the border of two
diverging tectonic plates creating an
abundance of energy generated from
within the earth it's landscape is
dotted with volcanoes and hot springs
and below ground
there are reserves of water heated by
geological activity Iceland uses this
energy to generate electricity at plants
like this and to heat homes and
businesses geothermal energy is also
used to heat more than a hundred public
pools across the country most of which
are open all year geothermal bathing has
been a part of Icelandic culture for
thousands of years some of the country's
natural Hot Springs are mentioned in
Icelandic sagas narratives that describe
the events in Icelandic history
today the pools are community spaces
some use the pools to exercise like the
people in this water aerobics class
below while others use them to relax and
socialize
